attributes.action: Give students a probation period before the accommodation contract binds them
attributes.additional_details: It seems as if the universities were dependent on the income from the residences, no matter how the residents are satisfied. They have lost the motivation to care about how the residents actually feel, and they would not change anything, as this is how it suits them. Therefore, it us up to the government to change it.
attributes.background: Students should be given a probation period (at least two weeks) to change their mind in case of strong dissatisfaction after a live experience. Most universities offer student accommodation with a fixed-term contract that does not allow students to terminate the contract freely.

rejection.details:
Decisions about tenancy agreements for university accommodation is a matter for universities and other accommodation providers, not the Government or House of Commons.

We have published the following petition relating to university accommodation during Covid-19, which you might like to sign:

Enable all students to end university tenancy agreements early due to Covid-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/553285
